task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application to perform batch operations
Capture current UI to locate the Mode menu and verify current app state before switching modes
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
Read the Mode menu contents to find the 'Batch processing' option
Select Batch processing mode so multiple files can be processed together (KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
Capture the UI after switching to Batch processing to discover batch controls (file add/open area, operations)
Open File menu to use the Open dialog for adding multiple files (use File->Open in Batch mode as alternative to missing 'Add files' button) (KB: open_files)
Read the File menu to locate the 'Open' command
Open the file selection dialog so multiple .MF4 files can be selected in Batch processing mode (KB: open_files)
Capture the Open dialog UI to find the 'File name' edit box and Open button
Focus the File name edit so the path/wildcard can be entered
Enter a wildcard path to list/select all .MF4 files in the target folder (own reasoning: using wildcard to select all files at once)
Execute the file name entry to populate the dialog with matching .MF4 files (own reasoning)
Allow the file dialog a moment to enumerate files in the folder
Select all listed .MF4 files in the dialog so they will be added to the batch (own reasoning)
Ensure the Open button is available in the dialog before clicking it
Confirm selection to add the selected files into the Batch processing list (KB: open_files)
Inspect the Batch processing UI now that files are loaded to find operation controls (Concatenate, options, output filename)
Select the Concatenate operation to create a continuous output file from the input files (KB: batch_concatenate_files)
Capture UI after selecting Concatenate to find synchronization option, output filename field, and Start/Save control

Toggle the 'Sync using measurement timestamps' option if present (ensure desired setting). KB suggests this option exists for concatenate operations (KB: batch_concatenate_files). Using click to ensure the option is set as intended (own decision: toggle to desired state if visible).
Locate the output filename edit in the concatenate dialog before entering the desired output path
Focus the output filename field so the new concatenated file name can be entered (KB: batch_concatenate_files)
Enter the full output path and filename for the concatenated MF4 (own reasoning)
Find the final Start/Save button to execute the concatenation
Start the batch concatenate operation to produce the output file (KB: batch_concatenate_files). If UI shows 'Save' instead of 'Start', the State-Tool prior ensures correct button is targeted.
Allow processing to begin and give time for the operation to complete or for progress to appear
Check the application state for completion messages or any errors after the concatenate operation

Switch to Batch processing mode (KB set_mode_batch_processing), use File->Open to add all .MF4 files (KB open_files) because the 'Add files' button may not be present (past failures), select the Concatenate operation (KB batch_concatenate_files), set synchronization option as needed, enter the specified output filename in the same folder, and start the operation. State-Tool calls are used before each interaction to ensure the correct UI elements are targeted and to avoid previously observed missing-button failures.
